title: How to Make Dirty Rice

steps.headline: Cook the rice for 20 minutes.
steps.description: In a medium saucepan, combine the water, bay leaf, and 1¼ cups (294 ml) of the chicken broth. Put a lid on the pan and bring the liquid to a boil over medium-high heat. When the liquid is boiling, add the rice and reduce the heat to medium. Cook the rice, covered, for 20 minutes. Remove the rice from the heat and set it aside. You can use any white rice you like in this recipe, such as jasmine or basmati. You can also use brown rice if you prefer, though dirty rice usually uses white.

steps.headline: Brown the ground beef.
steps.description: Pour the oil into a large, heavy-bottomed saucepan or Dutch oven. Heat the oil over medium heat. When the surface of the oil is shimmering, add the ground beef. Use the side of a spoon to break up the meat into evenly sized pieces. Heat the beef for a minute or two, until the bottom starts to brown. You can also cook the beef in bacon fat for an even richer dirty rice, or cook 5 pieces of chopped bacon with the ground beef. Breaking up the meat is important to ensure the meat cooks evenly.

steps.headline: Add the vegetables and cook for about 10 minutes.
steps.description: Transfer the chopped onion, celery, and pepper to the pan with the ground beef. Stir to combine all the ingredients. Cook the mixture for 7 to 10 minutes, stirring regularly, until the beef is cooked through and the vegetables are soft. For a spicier dirty rice, use a hot pepper, such as a jalapeno, instead of the green bell pepper.

steps.headline: Add the liver and seasonings.
steps.description: Add the chicken liver and garlic first, and stir to combine them with the beef and vegetables. Cook the mixture for 5 minutes, and then add the salt, Cajun, and thyme. Stir to incorporate all the spices into the meat and vegetables. To further enhance the flavor of the meat, you can add ½ teaspoon (1 g) of ground sage to the mixture as well. If you don’t like liver, replace it with more ground beef or ground sausages.

steps.headline: Deglaze the pan.
steps.description: Add the remaining ½ cup (118 ml) of chicken broth to the pan. Give the mixture a stir, and then let the broth cook for a minute. This will help to loosen the browned bits of meat and vegetables that have cooked to the bottom of the saucepan. To add a bit of sweetness and tang to the dirty rice, add 2 tablespoons (30 ml) of Worcestershire sauce when you add the remaining broth.

steps.headline: Combine the rice, meat, and vegetables before serving.
steps.description: Remove the bay leaf from the vegetable mixture first, and then stir in the rice. Continue stirring to fully incorporate the meat and vegetables into the rice. Remove the pan from the heat and serve the rice hot. As a side dish, serve dirty rice with your favorite mains, such as fried chicken, steak, gumbo, or stir fries.

steps.headline: Sauté the onion and garlic for 5 minutes.
steps.description: Pour the olive oil into a large, heavy-bottomed saucepan. Preheat the oil over medium heat, for about 2 minutes, until the surface is shimmering. Add the onion and garlic and cook the aromatics for 5 minutes, stirring regularly.

steps.headline: Add the vegetables and spices and cook for 10 minutes.
steps.description: Stir in the pepper, chili powder, pepper flakes, cumin, and cinnamon. Cook the vegetables and spices together for about 10 minutes, until the mixture is fragrant and the peppers are soft. For an even heartier dish, stem and dice a medium eggplant and cook it with the pepper and spices. To give the dish a reddish-brown color similar to traditional dirty rice, add 2 teaspoons (6 g) of annatto powder, or a mixture of turmeric and paprika.

steps.headline: Cook the rice with the vegetables for 25 minutes.
steps.description: Pour the broth, rice, and salt into the saucepan with the vegetables. Increase the heat to high and bring the mixture to a boil. When the liquid is boiling, reduce the heat to low, cover the pan, and cook the mixture for 25 minutes. You can use brown rice in place of the white rice in this recipe, especially if you want to give the dish a more traditional dirty rice look.

steps.headline: Add the remaining ingredients and cook together for 10 minutes.
steps.description: Add the tomatoes, corn, beans, and pine nuts to the cooked rice mixture. Stir to incorporate the ingredients, and continue cooking the mixture for about 10 minutes, until all the ingredients are heated through. Finally, add the black pepper and the lime juice and stir to incorporate. Instead of beans, you can add meatless ground round or crumbles, which is a vegetarian substitute for ground beef.

steps.headline: Enjoy the rice hot.
steps.description: You can garnish individual portions with a variety of toppings, such as sliced red onion, chopped cilantro or parsley, hot sauce, or a wedge of lime. You can enjoy this dish on its own as a complete meal, or as a side dish with soups, stir fries, barbecued tofu, or even in vegetarian burritos.
